intro: Pseuduvaria borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean pseuduvaria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub, adapting to the humid and shaded conditions of the tropical rainforest. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
